reviewText: This is a vey God poduction,it is accurate as far as the history goes and is biblically accurate as well. It is well worth buying.-FS

Graphic and intense.  An emotional look at the high compassion and full forgiveness Jesus Christ died to offer sinful mankind.  The ironic dynamic portrayed of a wrong-headed religious person versus the sorrowful heart of the "evil" brother clearly shows which attitude is necessary to see victory over the deserved penalty of sin.

Short, but excellent.
One of the best films I have seen. Brilliant at every level
Realistic account of the 2 thieves on the cross flanking Jesus. Worthwhile watching for the entire family.
This film brings me to tears each time I watch it. I'm reminded that in this life, one is never too far from the Saving grace of Jesus Christ. Great film for Easter! Great reminder for every day.
and NOW you are "sheep". At least a slave is HUMAN.
Well done look at the day of Jesus' crucifixion from the eyes of the 2 thieves who were crucified with Jesus.

Excellent short drama by Dallas Jenkins and Vertical Church. They also produced The Ride which is another outstanding film.
http://www.amazon.com/Ride-Christmas-Eve-Parable/dp/B00KTJ0PZW/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1426780297&sr=8-2&keywords=The+Ride%2C+dallas+jenkins
 Once We Were Slaves presents the Good Friday account from an entirely new perspective and powerfully communicates the astounding nature of God's grace! Highly recommended to churches for Easter outreach or for individuals to share with friends and family. Dallas Jenkins is an excellent director, best known for What If... http://www.amazon.com/What-If-Kevin-Sorbo/dp/B004KPD1IO/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1426780508&sr=8-2&keywords=what+if...
